author: markekraus
body:
closes #5373
reference #4357
reference #3267

* Removes/normalizes `#ifdef` code for Full CLR
* Removes Full CLR files already marked for removal in `Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.Utility.csproj`
* Makes `-UseBasicParsing` parameter hidden.
* Removes logic for `-UseBasicParsing` as the cmdlets now always basic parsing https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/3267#issuecomment-286917402
* Removes Format data for `HtmlWebResponseObject` 
* removes phantom properties  `Forms` and `ParsedHtml` from format data for `BasicHtmlWebResponseObject`

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: @markekraus Could you please review all files and add a newline at EOF?

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @iSazonov All of the files I modified in the PR have a newline EOF. Some of them did not have one before and just ended with `#endif`.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus does it make sense to move the files in `common` and `CoreCLR` to the parent and get rid of those subdirs?

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT If it were up to me. I would combine the core partials and the common partials and move them all to the parent webcmdlet folder. It would definitely make these a lot easier to work on since there is no FullCLR to contend with. I'm not sure if it makes sense to do that and this cleanup in the same PR, though. But I would definitely want it that way, whether in this PR or another.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
I believe it is more easily and faster to review small PRs.
The PR LGTM and I vote to merge now.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @iSazonov do you think I should do the merging of partials in one PR and then the file moves in another? otherwise... it will just look like I created new classes in parent folder and deleted old ones. Hard to see how they were put together. I could just do them as 2 commits in the same PR too.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus use `git mv` and git will report the file was just moved

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT  as an example, I want to take `WebCmdlet\Common\BasicHtmlWebResponseObject.Common.cs` and `WebCmdlet\CoreCLR\BasicHtmlWebResponseObject.CoreClr.cs`, and combine them to `WebCmdlet\BasicHtmlWebResponseObject.cs`

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus I see, if you're combining files, I agree you should do that as a separate PR.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT for clarity, should I do 1 PR for combining, and another PR for the move? Or just do both in 1 PR (with 2 commits)?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus I think you can just do 1 PR for combining/move and have them as separate commits

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus can you resolve the merge conflict?  As discussed in the issue, we'll defer further clean-up work and should merge this once the merge conflict is resolved

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT conflict resolved, but I just realized I never ran Feature tests in this PR. so running now.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
The one of the fails (`EventResource`) in AppVeyor is appearing in all builds, not just this one. I assume it's a known issue. 

The other is a timeout fail from httpbin.org (I will get those tests all moved over to `WebListener` someday).

As for Travis CI, it seems to be having unrelated issues

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body: Yes, we are waiting #5379 to pass CI AppVeyor.

title: Clean Up Full CLR Code From Web Cmdlets
